userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hamner Family Land Papers, Manuscript MS 89.11, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Hamner family were property owners of Albemarle and Buckingham Counties, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers consist of deeds, land grants, and a plat of Charles W. Hamner and others mostly for land in Buckingham County, Va. Included are a land grant (1761?) for land in Albemarle County to William Megginson from Gov. Francis Fauquier; deed (1825) for land in Buckingham County to Charles W. Hamner from Mary and Robert Rogers; deed for land in Buckingham County near Oakville to John C. Hamner from Joseph and Elizabeth Burke; copy of a plat (1837) of land near Back Island Creek in Buckingham County; and land grant (1827) for land in Buckingham County from Gov. William B. Giles to Charles W. Hamner.

did.unittitle: Land grant to William Megginson from Lt. Gov. Francis Fauquier for land in Ablemarle County, Virginia, 14 [January 1761]
Deed. Mary and Robert Rogers to Charles W. Hamner. Land in Buckingham County, Virginia, on Wreckisland Creek, 27 September 1825.
Land grant. Gov. William B. Giles to Charles W. Hamner. Land in Buckingham County, Virginia, 9 November 1827.
Copy of plat drawn by Wyatt W. Hamner of land on Back Island Creek, Buckingham County, Virginia 2 November 1837.
Deed. Joseph Burke and Elizabeth Burke to John C. Hamner. Sale of land in Buckingham County, near Oakville, 10 October 1844.
